Pre-Game Insights: Game 2 of the NL Wild Card series between the New York Mets and the Milwaukee Brewers takes place at American Family Field after the Mets grabbed a commanding 8-4 win in Game 1.
The Brewers are looking to force a Game 3, but their pitching inconsistency combined with the Mets’ hot offense could lead to another high-scoring affair.
Sean Manaea will take the mound for New York, while Milwaukee counters with Frankie Montas.
The Mets come into Game 2 with momentum after a convincing 8-4 victory in Game 1.
The Brewers’ offense has been led by Willy Adames, who hit 32 home runs with 112 RBIs, and William Contreras, who batted .281.
Frankie Montas will take the ball for Milwaukee in this do-or-die game.
